intro: Senegalia guangdongensis, commonly known as Guangdong acacia, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it resilient to drought conditions. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various insects and animals.
